Message.Text: Tommy, I can’t believe you’re still pushing for SQL! NoSQL is clearly the way to go for this project!
And I can’t believe you refuse to see the importance of SQL! It’s the foundation of reliable database management!
Reliable? It’s outdated! NoSQL is more suitable for the diverse data we’re dealing with!
Outdated? That’s absurd! SQL has been tried and tested. NoSQL lacks the structure we desperately need!
Structure? You mean rigidity! NoSQL allows for flexibility, which is essential in today’s development!
Flexibility doesn’t mean anything without a solid foundation! If you don’t have structure, you’re asking for disaster!
Disaster? More like stagnation! We can’t keep holding on to outdated practices just because they’re familiar!
Familiarity is not the issue! It’s about ensuring our project won’t fall apart because of some trendy framework!
Trendy? You’re so stuck in your ways, Tommy! NoSQL is the future, and it’s frustrating to see you ignore that!
Frustrating? Try being realistic! If you keep pushing this NoSQL agenda, we might end up regretting it!
